value: Fire Screen: The Sense of Taste

label: Description
value: Screen design depicting two Chinese boys, one eating a slice of melon, while the other points his finger and holds a melon still attached to the tree above them. Image framed by rocaille design with vegetal and floral motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Etching, printed from two plates, hand colored with brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: At left a man on a ladder gathers grapes which he hands to a woman carrying grapes in her apron. Seated at right are a man and a woman to whom he offers grapes and fruit. Under an arch of trellis-work on which grape vines grow. An apple (?) tree in the background. Bottom: a leopard (?) sits on rocaille and shell motifs over: "LE GOUST. / à Paris chés Charpentier, rue St. Jacques au Coq. Avec privilège du Roy". Bottom left: "Mondon invenit".

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A stylishly dressed man embraces a woman whose husband stands are right. Surrounded by trees, rocaille, and a framing of rocaille, shells, fruits, etc., with an escutcheon top center, with: "LE BAISÉ DONNÉ / Guillot passoit un jour avec sa Marié le Seigneur du village (?) à la charge dautant très volontiers / elle est bien a votre service / sans d'autres compliments / le galant fit l'Office". In an escutcheon, bottom center: "OSCULUM ACCEPTUM / d'um sequitur Galatea sum nova sponsa Menal / cum Villorum princeps… / … / … / Dat Galatea viro". Below: "à Paris chez Basset rue st. Jacques au coin de la rue des Mathurins".

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: The woman's husband is about to kiss a fashionably dressed woman, while the stylishly dressed man stands by, at right. A g room at left. In landscape. Ornamented border. In an escutcheon, top center: "LE BAISER RENDU / par bonheur pour Guillot, notre galant Seigneur / Bien peu de jours après pour l'hymen fit empletter d'une Dame Charmante et d'agréable humeur / Riche, de noble race, enfin toute parfaite / Et malgré les honneurs d'un état florissant / Ce que n'est pas commun il fut reconnoissan." In escutcheon, bottom  center: "Du baiser qui obtient le souvenir l'exite / a vouloir qu'aussitot Madame l'en acquite / De ce trait genereux le Manant en chanté / Et qui n'attendoit pas tant de fidelité, Secrie: "Ah que mal joye aurait été complette / Si Monsieur eut voulu avec Lizette." Bottom right: "A Paris chez Basset le jeune rue de Mathurins a S. Genevieve."

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Solomon, on a throne, stops the soldier who is about to cut a live baby in half, at left. The real mother of the baby tries to protect the child, where as the other, at right, points at him. The dead child lies at the foot of the throne. Two spectators on either side. In landscape with buildings in background. Bottom: "a Paris chez Charpentier rue S. Jacques au Coq". "Jugement se Salomon"; "Avec Privilege du Roi".

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Ahasverus rises from his throne, at left, to extend his scepter to Estcher who is fainting and supported by women. A guard with a spear and an old man are by the throne. Trees at right and left. Bottom: "Esther devant assvarus" "à Paris chés Charpentier rue St. Jacques au Coq. Avec privilège du Roy".

Laban reproves Jacob for leaving secretely

label: Description
value: Left side of a panel. The two men are at right, under a tree. At left are four men, three of whom carry spears, and a horse. In rocky landscape.

label: Physical description
value: Hand-colored etching with watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Right portion of panel. Shows Jephthah standing with his eyes uplifted and one hand stretched out, among other men in armor, on a hill, beneath a tree. Below the hill, at right, are three soldiers and a chariot drawn by two horses.

label: Description
value: At left a woman and a kneeling man are amelling flowers taken from a basket which he holds. A shepherdess stands at right, surrounded by sheep. On a little hill beyond them is a circular building in which is a partially draped statue of a woman.

label: Physical description
value: Etching, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: At left a couple with a mirror, a couple reading from a book with magnifying and eye glasses; at right a woman looking thorugh a telescope. Surrounded by trees in landscape with houses, a tower, a bridge. Bottom margin left: "ET TERRAE, et Coeli, quid habend miracula pulchris / Haec si non oculis t anta videre queas". Center: "LA VUE / a Paris chez Daudet". Right: "Les miracles diverse de la Terre et des Cieux / Ne seroient rien poir nous s'il nous manquoit [very small] les yeux".

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: In the foreground are white men and women and American Indians smoking the peace pipe, carrying bundles, and embarking from a small boat. Larger ships are in the harbour in the middle ground, and in the background is a fortress. Palm and pine trees. Bottom center: "l'Arrivé des Vaisseaux aux Isles de l'Amerique".

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A fashionably dressed man and woman, left, approach a group of people, at right, one of whom rolls a barrel, while another writes on a paper on a bale makred [stylized 4s] and [upside-down female symbol]. A ship is in the harbor in the middle ground. At right, a fragment of architecture with two columns, an incense burner. A fortified town in the background. Trees. Bottom: "l'Ouverture du Commerce".

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: A boar, running from right, is pursued by dogs and attacked by three men with a spear, a gun, and a fork-like weapon. Another man blows a bugle. In landscape with trees. Bottom center: "LA CAZA DEL XAVALI / Venatio Aprorum".

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A lion, center, is attacked by dogs, a man with a forked spear, and another at right, on a unicorn. Another, at left, blows a trumpet. All in "Oriental" costume. In landscape with houses in background. Bottom center: "LA CAZA DEL LEON / Venatio Leonum".

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A woman holding a censer points to an incense burner at left. A man with a long-stemmed pipe offers her a cup of something. At right, a man with a crescent on his turban carries ticks in his arms. At left, in the background, are a camel and a truncated pyramid. Ornamented border of rocaille and plants. Bottom center: "ASIA".

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A turbaned African woman is seated at center, a man holds an umbrella over her. Another man with a scythe is seated at left before a wheat field. A tent, a monkey, an elephant, at right. Shield and quiver in the foreground. Ornamental border of rocaille and plants. Bottom center: "AFRICA".

Symbols of authority, attributes of war, the sciences, and the arts in the foreground and in the ornamented border. Bottom center: "EVROPA".
